metadata.title: CVE-2019-8320 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A Directory Traversal issue was discovered in RubyGems 2.7.6 and laterthrough 3.0.2. Before making new directories or touching files (which nowinclude path-checking code for symlinks), it would delete the targetdestination. If that destination was hidden behind a symlink, a maliciousgem could delete arbitrary files on the user's machine, presuming theattacker could guess at paths. Given how frequently gem is run as sudo, andhow predictable paths are on modern systems (/tmp, /usr, etc.), this couldlikely lead to data loss or an unusable system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.2
ruby2.5 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.5 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1-1ubuntu1.2').
jruby: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
